The integral of the first term [(1+x)/(x^2)(1+x)] is (1/x^2). Notice that we can cancel out one of the (1+x) terms in the denominator with the one in the numerator. So, the indefinite integral of the first term is (1/x^2).

The integral of the second term -x/(x^2)(1+x) can be simplified as -1/x(1+x). We can rewrite this term as -1/x + 1/(1+x).
